content:
• Monday, September 19, 2016
  • TXMD

    FDA to review TherapeuticsMD's marketing application for dyspareunia candidate; action date May 7, 2017; shares up 6% after hours

    • TherapeuticsMD (NYSEMKT:TXMD) is ahead 6% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has accepted for review its New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of TX-004HR (estradiol softgel capsule) for the treatment of moderate-to-severe dyspareunia (vaginal pain during intercourse). The agency's action date is May 7, 2017.
    • TX-004HR, if approved, will be marketed under the brand name Yuvvexy.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • CYH

    Reuters: Apollo Global in talks to buy Community Health Systems assets

    • Community Health Systems (NYSE:CYH) +7.1% AH higher following a Reuters report that Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) is among P-E firms and REITs in talks to acquire some of the company's assets.
    • APO is seeking to add scale to its RegionalCare Hospital Partners portfolio company with more hospitals, according to the report.
    • CYH said earlier that it was in the early stages of exploring a variety of options with unnamed financial sponsors, as well as other unspecified alternatives.
    • On Friday, Bloomberg published a report speculating on a potential sale of CYH that offered few statistics.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM | 6 Comments
  • COMM

    University of Tennessee upgrades networks with CommScope solution

    • A University of Tennessee upgrade to its networks has come via CommScope's (COMM +1.9%) Powered Fiber Cable System.
    • The university used CommScope's system to upgrade security and deploy more wireless access points outside, without the need to run new power lines.
    • The technology allows for delivering power over Ethernet (PoE) at 30 times the distance of traditional PoE. That means deploying new network points without electricians and hiding the access points in lampposts and existing street works.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: PIR +6.8%. HDP +5.3%. SRPT +3.3%. EVBG +2.6%. CXRX-OLD +2.3%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: ASNA -23.1%. SEAS -8.6%. ECA -5.4%. OCLR -5.0%. MLHR -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • ASNA

    Weak guidance sends Ascena Retail into a tailspin

    • Shares of Ascena Retail (NASDAQ:ASNA) are down sharply after FQ4 earnings and updated guidance disappoint investors.
    • Ongoing store traffic headwinds have pushed quarter-to-date comparable sales negative in the current quarter after they fell 4% in FQ4.
    • The company expects FY17 revenue of $6.9-$7.0B vs. $7.17B consensus and FY17 EPS of $0.60-$0.65 vs. $0.83 consensus.
    • Previously: Ascena Retail Group misses by $0.08, beats on revenue (Sept. 19)
    • ASNA -24.01% AH to $6.17.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • CHK

    Icahn cuts Chesapeake stake by more than half to 4.5%

    • Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) -4.1% AH after Carl Icahn discloses in a 13D statement that he has cut his active stake in the company to 35.3M shares, or 4.55%; in August, Icahn and his partners reported holdings of ~73M shares in the company, or 9.4%.
    • Icahn says he reduced the CHK position to recognize a capital loss for tax planning purposes, but says CEO Doug Lawler and his team "have done an admirable job, especially in light of the circumstances."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM | 132 Comments
  • SEAS

    Seaworld tumbles after suspending dividend

    • The company will make one more payout of $0.10 per share (down from previous $0.21), and will then suspend further dividends. Money will instead by deployed into "opportunistic" share repurchases.
    • SEAS -7.2% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 19 Comments
  • OCLR

    Oclaro offering 13M newly issued common stock shares; -5% after hours

    • Option to grant up to 1.95M additional Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) shares noted.
    • Proceeds intended for general corporate purposes (working capital, capital expenditures, other corporate expenses, and acquisitions of complementary products, technologies or businesses).
    • Jefferies, Needham & Company, Stifel and Craig-Hallum Capital Group to manage offering.
    • Prospectus
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 6 Comments
  • ECA

    Encana to launch 107M-share offering

    • Encana (NYSE:ECA) -4.5% AH after announcing a 107M-share public offering, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 16.05M common shares.
    • ECA says it plans to use roughly half the proceeds to fund part of its 2017 capital program, and the rest to pay down debt under its credit facilities.
    • ECA says most of its 2017 capital program will be used to grow its Permian Basin production through increasing the number of rigs in the play, which should should result in ~2x as many Permian wells onstream in 2017 from 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 11 Comments
  • CVRR

    CVR Refining, Velocity Midstream to build Oklahoma oil pipeline

    • CVR Refining (CVRR -13%) plunges following news it has acquired a 40% stake in a new joint venture with Velocity Midstream Partners for a new crude oil pipeline connecting the SCOOP play in central Oklahoma to Velocity's refinery in Wynnewood, Okla.; financial terms are not disclosed.
    • Benzinga's Joel Elconin says Friday's sharp rise and today's drastic decline in CVRR shares is not related to any fundamental news; traders attempting to profit from a large sell imbalance on Friday's close were caught off-guard when the stock switched to a large buy imbalance moments before the closing bell, sending the shorts scrambling to cover, followed by today's rapid reversal and correction.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 11 Comments
  • LMT

    Lockheed Martin upgrade at Wells Fargo, which eyes $20 EPS by 2020

    • Lockheed Martin (LMT +1.5%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform with a price target of $275-$280, raised from $255-$260, at Wells Fargo, which believes earnings can grow at a 20% compound annual growth rate through 2020.
    • Wells sees the potential for earnings of $20/share in 2020 and upward revisions to EPS estimates in the out years moving the stock higher, with higher U.S. defense spending, F-35 growth and pension income as the key drivers of LMT's earnings growth.
    • In the short term, however, the firm expects LMT to report a "messy" Q3, including a reduction in 2016 EPS guidance; it also expects LMT to announce another double-digit dividend increase following its Sept. 22 board meeting.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 20 Comments

  • Stocks give up gains late in session

    • Early gains for the averages have faded towards the close, with the Dow and S&P 500 now flat on the session, and the Nasdaq lower by 0.15%.
    • The homebuilders continue to outperform following strong housing data earlier. The ITB is higher by 1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANET

    Arista Networks -3%; downgraded at MKM partners

    • Analyst Michael Genovese sets a Neutral rating down from a previously held Buy. He forecasts conditions that could contribute to lower-than-expected Q3 gross margins.
    • Genovese: "The company guided 3Q16 GMs to 62%-65%, which assumes the large majority of demand is fulfilled by the offshore supply chain. The outlook beyond 3Q16 is 60%-65% depending on Customs approval and supply chain mix. We think 4Q16 GMs could be at the lower end of the range so we are reducing our estimate to 62.1% from 63.3%. Consensus is 62.9%. Similarly, we are lowering our 2017 GMs forecast to 62.5% from 63.3%, and consensus is meaningfully higher at 63.9%."
    • Does note some positives on Arista Networks' (ANET -3.4%) router opportunity, though doesn't consider it to be a "game changer".
    • Price target of $79 (current price $82.11).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:15 pm

    • Gainers: BLOX +15%. CEVA +11%. EVDY +9%. ASUR +8%. EMAN +8%.
    • Losers: MGT -24%. AEHR -11%. DQ -7%. NH -7%. WTT -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • LGCY

    Legacy Resources, Vanguard Natural Resource cut to Sell at Stifel

    • Legacy Resources (LGCY -12.8%) and Vanguard Natural Resources (VNR -6.8%) are downgraded to Sell from Hold with $0.50 price targets at Stifel following elevated concerns with liquidity and perceived credit facility risk.
    • Stifel says LGCY has a runway to manage through the current environment but views the company starting to run short despite management's active stance YTD with monetizing non-core assets.
    • On VNR, the firm says prospects would be more favorable if it were to receive outside funding to improve its balance sheet or anticipated liquidity strains, significant recovery in commodity prices, or a favorable fall redetermination.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 68 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:15 pm

    • Gainers: GSM +10%. ALDW +9%. TANH +9%. BRS +7%. PZG +7%.
    • Losers: ERN -11%. LGCY -11%. CVRR -10%. AMTX -8%. SAEX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • X

    U.S. Steel, AK Steel upgraded at KeyBanc after getting cut just last month

    • U.S. Steel (X +5%) and AK Steel (AKS +3.9%) are upgraded to Sector Weight from Underweight at KeyBanc, which says the stocks at current levels better reflect the more competitive market conditions expected in Q4 and in 2017.
    • KeyBanc sees is a stronger investor appreciation for near-term and sheet supply and demand risk in 2017.
    • The firm downgraded the steel stocks just a month ago, citing caution on prospects for the U.S. carbon sheet market.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 4 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter retracing Thursday Night Football gains; -4%

    • Twitter (TWTR -3.7%) shares rose almost 5% from Thursday's close into Friday morning trading, though current levels ($18.34) are now just about unchanged (0.16%) from that same reference point.
    • Initial user sentiment surrounding Twitter's first NFL game live-stream was positive, but viewer figures potentially more-subdued-than-expected for the anticipated first matchup released late Friday may be contributing to the downward move.
    • Twitter registered an average of 243,000 viewers per minute and 2.1M total unique viewers worldwide of the stream. CBS and the NFL Network, meanwhile, counted 15.4M average viewers per minute and total viewership of 48.1M.
    • While these metrics are of course not equally comparable and with Twitter still experimenting with the format (suggestions and improvements to be built upon), it's too soon to speculate a concrete verdict. Nonetheless, the company has now set itself a benchmark that investors will utilize to measure future Thursday evening games against.
    • NFL Communications data
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 21 Comments
  • WFC

    Mike Mayo weighs in on Wells Fargo - Stumpf should stay

    • The CLSA analyst calls for holding management accountable by clawing back at least some of the $125M the head of Community Banking (Carrie Tolstedt) is receiving, clawbacks and/or reduced pay for CEO John Stumpf, making a change for the board's head of the Corporate Responsibility Committee (Federico Pena), and questions or some sort of statement from lead director Stephen Sanger.
    • As for the future of John Stumpf, Mayo thinks he should keep his job given a near decade of revenue, return, risk, and stock price outperformance versus peers, and a lack of evidence that the fish stunk from the head.
    • As for WFC's stock price, it's clawing back some of its losses of the past couple of weeks, up 1.2% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 50 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: SRPT +91%. ISLE +30%. PTCT +23%. TECD +21%. CRMD +18%. SMMT +17%. BLOX +15%. TANH +15%. LPTN +14%. SORL +13%.
    • Losers: VICL -22%. MGT -20%. MICT -14%. CVRR -13%. RGSE -12%. MYOK -11%. ERN -11%. OCRX -9%. PDEX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • SRPT

    Sell-side cheerleaders in good form following approval of Sarepta's eteplirsen

    • Sell-side analysts, never bashful with their pie-in-sky valuation models, are wasting little time jumping on the Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +90.3%) bandwagon. Piper Jaffray, William Blair and Janney Montgomery Scott have all upgraded the stock from Neutral to Buy.
    • Baird takes the top prize by raising its price target to $102 (91% upside) from $23 based, of course, on many heroic assumptions.
    • As always, retail investors should be cautious here.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 11 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate -4.4% as 'Blair Witch' can't dent 'Sully' mojo

    • Lions Gate (LGF) is off 4.4% after its critically mixed horror film Blair Witch fell well short of knocking off Sully (TWX +1.4%) from the top of the box-office chart.
    • Blair Witch was the best of three top-five debuts, but Sully's $22M kept it on top for the second straight week.
    • Lions Gate's new revisit to the woods of its 1999 cult film The Blair Witch Project pulled just $9.7M despite opening in more than 3,000 theaters. It has a "36% Fresh" rating on review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes.
    • Just behind at No. 3 was another disappointing showing in Bridget Jones's Baby (CMCSA -0.2%), with $8.2M, followed by Snowden (AMC -0.2%, RGC) with $8M.
    • Sully, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Tom Hanks, has hit $70.5M cumulative in its two weeks, and $93.9M total worldwide.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • SRPT

    Summit Therapeutics joins Sarepta's party; shares up 16%

    • The stampede into Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +87.4%) over the FDA's approval of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) drug eteplirsen has rippled out beyond PTC Therapeutics (PTCT +26.1%).
    • Thinly traded UK-based Summit Therapeutics (SMMT +16.1%) is up on more than an 11x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 53K shares. Its DMD candidate is Phase 2-stage ezutromid (formerly SMT C1100), a modulator of a protein called utrophin which is structurally and functionally similar to dystrophin. The company says it has the potential to treat all young men with DMD, not just those amenable to exon 51 skipping (~13% of DMD cases).
    • PTC's DMD product is protein restoration therapy Translarna (ataluren), currently available in Europe on an annual renewal basis.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • GPRO

    GoPro +8%; unveils Hero 5 Black, Hero 5 Session, Karma

    • GoPro's CEO Nick Woodman kicked of the company's launch event noting a goal of providing an "end-to-end storytelling solution."
    • GoPro's (GPRO +8%) Hero 5 Black (available October 2) features waterproofing without housing, voice control, image stabilization, GPS, 4K video and 12 megapixel photo taking capabilities. Priced at $399.
    • Hero 5 Session (available October 2) offers 4K video ability, voice control and 10 megapixel photo taking. Priced at $299.
    • Karma drone system revealed (available October 23). Priced at $799, compatible with Hero 4 and Hero 5.
    • GoPro Plus cloud subscription service announced.
    • The developments mark a long-awaited release of new products just before the upcoming holiday season and with the company down around 50% on the year, hope for a return to higher share-price levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 41 Comments
  • TOL

    Homebuilders higher alongside big jump in confidence

    • The NAHB Index jumped six points to a one-year high of 65 this month vs. expectations for just a marginal gain.
    • "With the inventory of new and existing homes remaining tight, builders are confident that if they can build more homes they can sell them," says NAHB Chief Economist Robert Dietz.
    • The Lindsey Group's Peter Boockvar calls this month's print "ebullient," but says the key to sustain things will be the behavior of the first-time homebuyer. We're at a 50-year low in the homeownership rate - will potential first-timers continue to prefer renting? The area most in need of new homes are those priced below $250K (to better compete against renting), but margin issues don't make this a terribly profitable segment for homebuilders.
    • ITB +1.9%, XHB +1.5%
    • Toll Brothers (TOL +1.4%), PulteGroup (PHM +3.1%), D.R. Horton (DHI +2.5%), Lennar (LEN +2.5%), Hovnanian (HOV +2.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 3 Comments

  • Consumer Goods - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: SORL +14%. ABAC-OLD +10%. LTEA +9%. GPRO +6%. ZX +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 7 Comments
  • VSAT

    ViaSat +2.1% after prevailing in government anti-jamming contract

    • ViaSat (VSAT +2.1%) has won a $33.3M contract with the government, for the Protected Tactical Service Field Demonstration.
    • The deal is a cost-plus-incentive fee contract, and ViaSat prevailed among five bids. The technology provides wideband anti-jam communications across government and commercial satellites.
    • Such technology can help U.S. military forces stay connected. The government can move more rapidly with off-the-shelf systems and using the commercial satellite fleet.
    • Work on the contract will be done at Carlsbad, Calif., and is expected to be completed by September 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • CALD

    Credit Suisse sets Outperform rating on Callidus Software

    • Following an earlier downgrade to Sell at Dougherty & Company, Credit Suiise reinstates coverage on Callidus Software (CALD -3.3%) with a $22 price target (current price $18.26). Callidus' recent 4M share stock offering is cited as potentially enabling acquisitions and furthering R&D efforts.
    • Analyst Michael Nemeroff: "We view CALD shares as attractive due to the company's: (1) best-of-breed, fully integrated product suite, which competes against mostly point solutions, (2) significant cross-sell / up-sell opportunity of multiple products into its existing customer base (only 400 out of 4,800 are using multiple CALD products)." Callidus Software's margin profile and transition to a 100% subscription revenue model also noted.
    • Estimates respective FY 2016 and FY 2017 revenue of $205M and $240.3M, and respective EPS of $0.27 and $0.28.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • EPD

    Enterprise Products upgraded at Credit Suisse as merger worries overdone

    • Enterprise Products Partners (EPD +3.6%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral with a $34 price target at Credit Suisse, citing EPD's conservative distribution policy, high quality and interconnected asset footprint, and best in class management team.
    • Credit Suisse thinks the market is still pricing the possibility of EPD acquiring Williams Cos. at an aggressive price, but that EPD is unlikely to consider terms which would be value destructive or dilutive even if talks resume.
    • "EPD has lot of legroom before a prospective deal becomes dilutive, suggesting that investor concerns on this topic are overblown," Credit Suisse says.
    • The firm also notes EPD's $5B-plus backlog, which provides a solid basis for future growth as well as its outlook for a five-year 5% compound annual growth rate for the distribution.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 4 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: SRPT +76%. PTCT +22%. CRMD +19%. SMMT +14%. ADMA +12%.
    • Losers: VICL -24%. MYOK -7%. PDEX -7%. GBSN -7%. HEB -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 15 Comments
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma tracks higher after posting guidance update

    • Williams-Sonoma (WSM +1.4%) backs prior guidance for FY16 EPS of $3.45 to $3.55. The mid-point of the company's range is ahead of the consensus estimate of $3.50.
    • The company's three-year outlook is for revenue growth in the mid to high single-digits and EPS growth at a double-digit to mid-teens pace.
    • Management expects to pay out 35% to 49% of net income in dividends.
    • Williams-Sonoma presentation slides (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • ERI

    Regional casino stocks perk up for Eldorado-Isle of Capri deal

    • Regional casino stocks are drawing some interest after Eldorado Resorts (ERI -1%) acquired Isle of Capri (ISLE +30.2%) for a sweet 36% premium.
    • Gainers include Monarch Casino & Resort (MCRI +4.9%), Red Rock Resorts (RRR +2.7%), Golden Entertainment (GDEN +1.2%), and Boyd Gaming (BYD +0.9%).
    • The combination of Eldorado and Isle of Capri will create a regional player with casinos spread across ten states. The early indication is that major shareholders of both company have backed the deal.
    • Previously: Eldorado Resorts acquires Isle of Capri Casinos (Sept. 19)
    • Related ETF: BJK.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • GERN

    Geron inks license deal with Janssen Pharma valued up to $80M

    • Geron (GERN +6.4%) heads north on increased volume in response to its announcement of a license deal with Janssen Pharmaceuticals (JNJ +0.2%). The company has granted Janssen exclusive global rights to develop and commercialize products based on Geron's specialized oligonucleotide backbone chemistry in addition to RNA interference candidates for the treatment of all human disorders except blood and bone marrow cancers and exclusive of telomerase inhibitors.
    • Geron has also granted Janssen a non-exclusive global license to develop and commercialize oligonucleotides based on Geron's patents covering the synthesis of monomers (building blocks of oligonucleotides). Janssen Biotech has non-exclusive rights to the same intellectual property under their November 2014 imetelstat agreement.
    • Under the terms of the deal, Geron will receive an upfront payment of $5M, up to $75M in milestones and low-single-digit royalties on global net sales of each licensed product.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 35 Comments
  • HEP

    Holly Energy in $275M dropdown deal for refinery units from HollyFrontier

    • Holly Energy Partners (HEP +2.1%) agrees to acquire certain Woods Cross Refinery units constructed as part of the Woods Cross expansion from HollyFrontier (HFC +1.2%) for ~$275M.
    • The companies say they will enter into 15-year tolling agreements for each respective unit containing minimum quarterly throughput commitments from HFC.
    • HEP expects the deal to be immediately accretive to unitholders and contribute towards the achievement of its 8% distribution growth target.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 5 Comments
  • BRS

    Bristow on the move

    • Bristow (BRS +10%) discloses an amended and restated revolving credit and term loan agreement and an amendment to a term loan credit agreement.
    • SEC Form 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • XTLY

    Callidus Software -3%; downgraded to Sell at Dougherty & Company

    • Sets $15 price target (current price $18.31).
    • Analyst Robert Mattson sees competitor Xactly (XTLY +1%) gaining market share while Callidus Software (CALD -3.2%) represents decreasing apportion and a falsely elevated valuation because of it.
    • Neutral rating previously held.
    • Callidus announced a 4M common stock share offering last Tuesday with the proceeds intended for working capital and other general purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • SRPT

    FDA OKs Sarepta's eteplirsen for Duchenne muscular dystrophy; shares rocket 76%

    • Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +76%) hits a grand slam on the news that the FDA has approved eteplirsen, branded as Exondys 51, for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).
    • The accelerated approval requires the company to conduct a new clinical trial to prove the drug's clinical benefit, specifically to assess whether Exondys 51 improves motor function in DMD patients amenable to exon 51 skipping. If the trial fails, the agency may withdraw its approval.
    • The approval process has been controversial because the efficacy data supporting the company's New Drug Application (NDA) was sparse, to say the least.
    • Potential competitor PTC Therapeutics (PTCT +16.6%) joins the party based on its DMD candidate Translarna.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 29 Comments
  • SRPT

    Trading in Sarepta halted due to volatility; FDA decision imminent?

    • NASDAQ has suspended trading in Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +11.6%) due to volatility. An FDA decision of eteplirsen may finally be at hand.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 16 Comments
  • SSC-OLD

    You On Demand buying control of M.Y. Products, rebranding as WeCast Networks

    • You On Demand (YOD) is up 3.2% in early going, having just signed an offer to buy most of M.Y. Products and moving to change its corporate name.
    • The company has a nonbinding term sheet with Sun Video Group HK Limited, an affiliate of YOD chairman Bruno Wu's, to buy 51% of M.Y. Products, a video commerce and supply chain management operator.
    • It's paying $50M in its common stock and $800,000 cash, and if MYP doesn't meet a guarantee of $200M top-line (and reach profitability) within 12 months, the stock will be forfeited back.
    • You on Demand is also changing its name to WeCast Network, effective in Q4. It's seeking to change its Nasdaq ticker to WCST.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • VICL

    Vical's CMV vaccine candidate flunks mid-stage study; shares off 22% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Vical (NASDAQ:VICL) slumps 22% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing its CMV vaccine candidate ASP0113 failed to meet its primary endpoint of a statistically valid proportion of patients achieving CMV viremia (viral load of at least 1,000 IU/mL at Year 1 after the first injection of study drug). The aim of the study was assess the safety and efficacy of ASP0113 in kidney transplant patients who received an organ from a CMV-seropositive donor.
    • ASP0113 also failed to beat placebo in the secondary endpoints of the incidence of CMV-associated disease and incidence of CMV-specific antiviral therapy.
    • On the plus side, the safety profiles were similar between the treatment groups.
    • Results from a Phase 3 study in hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT) patients are expected in Q4 2017.
    • Vical is developing Orphan Drug-tagged ASP0113 with collaboration partner Astellas (OTCPK:ALPMF)(OTCPK:ALPMY).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 8 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: ISLE +32%. BLOX +15%. NVAX +9%. GLPG +7%. CFRX +6%. EXK +5%.
    • Losers: VICL -22%. CVRR -13%. MGT -11%. CYH -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • GM

    GM tracks higher after Morgan Stanley calls out Auto 2.0 upside

    • Morgan Stanley shifts to an Overweight rating on General Motors (NYSE:GM) after having the automaker set at Neutral.
    • The investment firm boosts its price target on GM to $37 from $29.
    • "A move to Auto 2.0 requires a lengthy transition period (Auto 1.5) during which time GM can generate cash, return cash and nurture new businesses with potentially positive terminal values," reads the forward-looking MS note.
    • Things have been looking up for GM on the EV front after the early reviews for the Bolt came in positive.
    • Previously: Chevy Bolt dazzles in road test (Sept. 13)
    • Previously: Positive reviews for the Chevy Bolt as analysts ponder demand (Sept. 16)
    • GM +2.52% premarket to $31.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 6 Comments
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold buys Hidden Valley mine from Newcrest

    • Harmony Gold (NYSE:HMY) +2.7% premarket as it agree to acquire full ownership of the Hidden Valley mine in Papua New Guinea from 50-50 joint venture partner Newcrest Mining (OTCPK:NCMGF) for a nominal $1.
    • HMY says Hidden Valley has the potential to contribute 180K oz/year of gold to its production profile at an all-in sustaining cost of less than $950/oz within the next three years.
    • HMY says mining the stage 5 and 6 cutback will extend the current mine life by seven years and require an initial capital investment of ~$180M.
    • The companies will remain JV partners in the Wafi-Golfu project in Papua New Guinea.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 3 Comments
  • GPRO

    GoPro product launch event set for 12 PM ET; +5% pre-market

    • The unveiling of GoPro's (GPRO) Karma product is expected likely along with the long-awaited Hero 5.
    • GoPro shares have been rising since last Monday (+18%) and the introduction of new products into the lineup looks to extend the streak.
    • The company made its 360-degree Omni camera system available back in August.
    • GoPro: Karma Is Close
    • Live-stream
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • TERP

    TerraForm Power, TerraForm Global to explore strategic alternatives

  • WFC

    Wells Fargo: Baird buys the dip

    • Though seeing only modest upside for the banking sector as a whole, Wells Fargo's (NYSE:WFC) 10% decline over the past handful of sessions means limited downside risk, says Baird's David George, upgrading to Outperform with $50 price target.
    • He notes the stock trades at less than 6x pre-provision earnings and yields 3.4%.
    • Yes, there's still headline risk, particularly as exes are scheduled to testify before Congress this week. But George believes negative sentiment should be peaking alongside events in D.C. "The stock has gone from loved to loathed in two to three weeks, and we believe the sell-off creates a good relative buying opportunity."
    • Shares +0.5% premarket to $45.65.

  • NBY

    NovaBay's NVC-422 shows positive effect in reducing urinary catheter blockage in mid-stage study; shares up 14% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap NovaBay Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:NBY) is up 14% premarket, albeit on only 100 shares, in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2b clinical trial assessing its Auriclosene Irrigating Solution (AIS) (NVC-422) in preventing urinary catheter blockage and encrustation in patients with chronic indwelling urinary catheters who have a repeat history of blockage.
    • The Phase 2b study was a two-arm parallel design in 36 subjects with chronic indwelling catheters, including patients with spinal cord injuries and other neurological conditions. They were treated twice per week with either AIS or vehicle solution (citric acid buffer). Standard-of-care treatment for catheter irrigation is saline solution. AIS was compared to citric acid buffer because it has activity in minimizing encrustation.
    • Catheter flow rate measurements were taken in both arms and compared with flow measurements from identical new catheters (not sure what this means since the study should have compared AIS to vehicle) in a blinded evaluation. The company says the primary efficacy endpoint comparing the percent flow rate reduction of AIS-treated catheters to vehicle-treated catheters was achieved (p<0.05). Also, there was no catheter blockage in the AIS cohort compared to 28% in the vehicle group. The difference was supposedly statistically significant but no p value is given.
    • No serious adverse events were observed and AIS was generally well-tolerated.
    • Auriclosene is a synthetic molecule in a class of compounds called Aganocides. It is a non-antibiotic, fast-acting, broad-spectrum antimicrobial that mimics the action of human white blood cells against infection. According to the company, Aganocides have a lower likelihood that bacteria or viruses will develop resistance.
    • The company is actively pursuing partnering, licensing or joint venture arrangements to monetize the AIS program and advance it through late-stage development and registration.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM | 3 Comments

    Avnet sells Technology Solutions operation to Tech Data for $2.6B

    • Under the terms of the agreement, Avnet (NASDAQ:AVT) will receive $2.4B in cash and 2.8M shares of Tech Data (NASDAQ:TECD) common stock currently valued at about $200M.
    • "Moving forward, Avnet will focus its resources and investments on becoming a leader in design chain and supply chain services," says newish CEO William Amelio.
    • Avnet expects to book a gain of $3.75-$4.75 per share upon closing (anticipated in H1 of next year). For Tech Data's part, the deal is expected to be significantly accretive to non-GAAP EPS in the first year after closing.
    • An Avnet conference call is set for 11:30 ET. A Tech Data conference call is set for 8:30 ET.
